title: Semi-quantitative Detection of RNA-dependent RNA Polymerase Activity of Human Telomerase Reverse Transcriptase Protein
procedures:
1. Reagent Setup
Reagents used for Cell Synchronization
To generate Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (DMEM) containing 2.5 mM thymidine, dissolve 30.28 mg of thymidine per 1 mL of tissue culture grade water to prepare 125 mM thymidine. Filtrate the solution with a 0.22 μm syringe filter unit. Add 1 mL of freshly prepared 125 mM thymidine per 50 mL of DMEM supplemented with 10% (vol/vol) fetal bovine serum (FBS).
To generate DMEM containing 0.1 μg/mL of nocodazole, dissolve nocodazole in dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) to prepare 5 μg/μL nocodazole. Add 1 µL of 5 µg/ µL nocodazole per 50 mL of DMEM supplemented with 10% (vol/vol) FBS.
To generate DMEM containing 0.002% (vol/vol) of DMSO, add 1 µL of DMSO per 50 mL of DMEM supplemented with 10% (vol/vol) FBS.
Reagents used for IP-RdRP assay
Prepare lysis buffer A: 150 mM NaCl, 20 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.4) and 0.5% (vol/vol) Nonidet P-40 (NP-40). Store the reagent at 4 °C.
Prepare 5x acetate buffer: 50 mM 2-[4-(2-Hydroxyethyl)-1-piperazinyl]ethanesulfonic acid (HEPES)-KOH (pH 7.8), 500 mM potassium acetate and 20 mM MgCl2. Store the reagent at room temperature.
Prepare Wash buffer 1: 1x acetate buffer, 10% (vol/vol) glycerol, 0.1% (vol/vol) Triton X-100 and 0.06x protease inhibitor cocktail, ethylenediamenetetraacetic acid (EDTA)-free. Prepare Wash buffer 1 on the day of use or the day before use. Store the reagent at 4 °C.
Prepare AGC solution: 1x acetate buffer, 10% (vol/vol) glycerol and 0.02% (wt/vol) 3-[(3-Cholamidopropyl)dimethylammonio]-1-propanesulfonat (CHAPS). Store the reagent at 4 °C.
To generate AGC solution containing 2 mM CaCl2, add 100 µL of 1 M CaCl2 per 50 mL of AGC solution. Store the reagent at 4 °C.

To generate AGC solution containing 3 mM ethylene glycol bis (b-aminoethylether)-N,N,N',N'-tetraacetic acid (EGTA), add 375 µL of 0.4 M EGTA (pH 7.5) per 50 mL of AGC solution. Store the reagent at 4 °C.
Prepare Wash buffer 2: 1x acetate buffer and 0.02% (wt/vol) CHAPS. Store the reagent at 4 °C.
Prepare HMD solution: 0.2 M HEPES-KOH (pH 7.8), 40 mM MgCl2 and 2 mM dithiothreitol (DTT). Store the reagent at -20 °C.
		NOTE: HMD solution should be renewed at least in three months.
Prepare 2x Proteinase K buffer: 20 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.6), 20 mM EDTA and 1% (wt/vol) sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS). Store the reagent at -20 °C.
Prepare 2x loading buffer: 95% (vol/vol) formamide, 20 mM EDTA and 1% (wt/vol) Orange G. Store the reagent at -20 °C.
2. Preparation of HeLa cells
NOTE: Prepare HeLa cells synchronized in mitotic phase (manipulated) or dividing asynchronously (unmanipulated). Culture the cells in the presence of 5% CO2 at 37 °C.
Synchronization of HeLa cells in mitosis
Plate 1 x 106 of HeLa cells with 10 mL of DMEM supplemented with 10% (vol/vol) FBS in a 10 cm culture dish.
Two days after plating, replace the medium with 10 mL of DMEM containing 2.5 mM thymidine and 10% (vol/vol) FBS. Culture the cells for 24 h.
Wash the cells three times with 10 mL of phosphate buffered saline (PBS) (-), and culture the cells with 10 mL of DMEM containing 10% (vol/vol) FBS for 6 h.
Replace the medium with 10 mL of DMEM containing 0.1 µg/mL of nocodazole and 10% (vol/vol) FBS, and culture the cells for 14 h.
Shake the culture dish gently, and retrieve the supernatant containing the detached mitotic cells. Count the cell number for the IP-RdRP assay.

Centrifuge the sample at 490 x g for 5 min at 4 °C, and discard the supernatant.
		NOTE: The cell pellet can be stored at -80 °C.
Preparation of unmanipulated HeLa cells
Plate 1 x 106 of HeLa cells with 10 mL of DMEM supplemented with 10% (vol/vol) FBS in a 10 cm culture dish.
Two days after plating, replace the medium with 10 mL of DMEM containing 10% (vol/vol) FBS. Culture the cells for 30 h.
Replace the medium with 10 mL of DMEM containing 0.002% (vol/vol) DMSO and 10% (vol/vol) FBS, and culture the cells for 14 h.
Collect the cells by trypsinization using 0.7 mL of trypsin (2.5 g/L) containing 1 mM EDTA. Count the cell number for the IP-RdRP assay.
Centrifuge the sample at 490 x g for 5 min at 4 °C, and discard the supernatant.
		NOTE: The cell pellet can be stored at -80 °C.
3. IP-RdRP Assay
Protein A-agarose bead preparation
Transfer 1 mL (bed volume 500 µL) of affinity resin to a 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube. Centrifuge at 800 x g for 5 min at 4 °C, and discard the supernatant.
Add 800 µL of Lysis buffer A to the beads, and mix well by inverting the tube several times. Centrifuge at 800 x g for 3 min at 4 °C, and discard the supernatant. Repeat this step twice (total three washes).
Add 800 µL of Lysis buffer A to the beads, mix well by inverting the tube several times. Rotate the tube overnight (or for at least 4 h) at 4 °C on a rotary shaker.
Centrifuge the tube at 800 x g for 3 min at 4 °C, and discard the supernatant.

Add 500 µL of Lysis buffer A to the beads, and mix well by inverting the tube several times. Store the beads at 4 °C.
Preparation of cell lysate
(Optional) If the cells are frozen in step 2, place and thaw the frozen cells on ice until the cells become loose.
Wash the cells once with 10 mL of PBS (-). Centrifuge the sample at 1,450 x g for 5 min at 4 °C, and discard the supernatant.
Lyse the cells with ice-cold Lysis buffer A (1 mL of Lysis buffer A per 1 x 107 of the cells) by gentle pipetting.
Sonicate the sample in a 1.5 mL tube with following conditions; set amplification of the sonicator at 25%, and sonicate for 10 s.
Centrifuge the sample at 20,400 x g for 15 min at 4 °C.
Collect the supernatant. Transfer 1 mL each of the supernatant into 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tubes.
		CAUTION: Perform all procedures under RNase-free conditions.
Immunoprecipitation
Pre-clear the lysate from step 3.2.6 by adding 40 µL (bead volume 20 µL) of prewashed protein A-agarose beads per 1 mL of the lysate. Mix well by inverting the tube several times and rotate the sample for 30 min at 4 °C.
Centrifuge the sample at 13,000 x g for 1 min at 4 °C, and recover the supernatant.
Add 40 µL (bed volume 20 µL) of prewashed protein A-agarose beads and 10 µg of anti-human TERT antibody (clone: 10E9-2)8 into the pre-cleared lysate. Mix well by inverting the tube several times and rotate the sample at 4 °C over night.
Centrifuge the sample at 3,300 x g for 0.5 min at 4 °C, and remove the supernatant.

Wash the beads with Wash buffer 1: add 1 mL of Wash buffer 1 to the beads, mix well by inverting the tube, and rotate the sample for 5 min at 4 °C. Centrifuge the sample at 3,300 x g for 0.5 min at 4 °C, and remove the supernatant. Repeat this step three additional times.
Wash the beads once with AGC solution containing 2 mM CaCl2: add 1 mL of AGC solution containing 2 mM CaCl2 to the beads, mix well by inverting the tube, and rotate the sample for 5 min at 4 °C. Centrifuge the sample at 3,300 x g for 0.5 min at 4 °C, and remove the supernatant.
Treat the beads with Micrococcal nuclease (MNase): prepare the MNase reaction mixture described in Table 1. Resuspend the beads in 60 µL of the MNase reaction mixture by gentle pipetting. Shake the sample gently (20 to 25 rpm) on a turntable of a shaker set in a Peltier-type incubator for 15 min at 25 °C.
		NOTE: It is very important to use an undulating shaker and strictly follow the speed limit in this step. Other type of shakers, such as rotating mixers, are not recommended.
Centrifuge the sample at 3,300 x g for 0.5 min at 4 °C, and remove the supernatant.
Wash the beads twice with AGC solution containing 3 mM EGTA: add 1 mL of AGC solution containing 3 mM EGTA to the beads, mix well by inverting the tube, and rotate the sample for 5 min at 4 °C. Centrifuge the sample at 3,300 x g for 0.5 min at 4 °C, and remove the supernatant. Repeat this step once.

Wash the beads once with Wash buffer 2: add 1 mL of Wash buffer 2 to the beads, mix well by inverting the tube, and rotate the sample for 5 min at 4 °C. Centrifuge the sample at 3,300 x g for 0.5 min at 4 °C, and remove the supernatant. Keep the beads on ice while setting up RdRP reaction.
		CAUTION: Perform all procedures under RNase-free conditions.
RdRP reaction
Prepare a RdRP reaction mixture in a new tube as described in Table 2.
Add 6 µL of [α-32P]UTP (3,000 Ci/mmol) to the mixture and mix well by pipetting.
		NOTE: [α-32P]ATP, [α-32P]CTP, or [α-32P]GTP can be used for the reaction instead of [α-32P]UTP.
Add 1 µL of template RNA (1 µg/µL) to the mixture and mix well by pipetting.
		NOTE: To establish the RdRP assay, the following RNA template is recommended: 5'-GGGAUCAUGUGGGUCCUAUUACAUUUUAAACCCA-3' 9.
Resuspend the beads with 20 µL of the RdRP reaction mixture from step 3.4.3 by pipetting.
Shake the sample gently (20 to 25 rpm) on a turntable of a shaker set in a peltier-type incubator for 2 h at 32 °C.
Add 5.4 µL of Proteinase K (20 mg/mL) and 45.4 µL of 2x Proteinase K buffer to the reaction mixture. Mix by pipetting and shake (20 to 25 rpm) the sample on a turntable set in a Peltier-type incubator for 30 min at 37 °C.
Add 109.2 µL of RNase-free water to the sample.
Add 200 µL of acid phenol-chloroform to the sample. Mix well by vortex, and then centrifuge the sample at 21,100 x g for 5 min at room temperature. Transfer the aqueous phase to a new tube. Repeat this step once.

Add 20 µL of 3 M sodium acetate (pH = 5.2), 4 µL of precipitation carrier and 250 µL of ethanol to the aqueous phase. Shake the tube well for mixing, then centrifuge the sample at 21,100 x g for 20 min at 4 °C. Discard the supernatant.
Wash the pellet with 300 µL of cold 70% (vol/vol) ethanol stored at -20 °C. Centrifuge the sample at 21,100 x g for 15 min at 4 °C.
Discard the supernatant and air-dry the pellet.
		CAUTION: Perform all procedures under RNase-free conditions.
		NOTE: The pellet from step 3.4.11 can be stored at -20 °C for at least 2 days.
RNase treatment
Resuspend the pellet from step 3.4.11 in 20 µL of RNase-free water.
Prepare a RNase reaction mixture in a new tube as described in Table 3.
Add 180 µL of the RNase reaction mixture to the sample, and incubate the tube for 2 h at 37 °C.
Add 2.3 µL of 10% (vol/vol) SDS to the sample and incubate for 15 min at 37 °C.
Add 2 µL of Proteinase K (20 mg/mL) to the sample and incubate for 15 min at 37 °C.
Add 205 µL of acid phenol-chloroform to the sample. Mix well by vortex, then centrifuge the sample at 21,100 x g for 5 min at room temperature. Transfer the aqueous phase to a new tube.
Add 20 µL of 3 M sodium acetate (pH 5.2), 4 µL of precipitation carrier and 250 µL of ethanol to the aqueous phase. Shake the tube well for mixing, then centrifuge the sample at 21,100 x g for 20 min at 4 °C. Discard the supernatant.

Wash the pellet with 300 µL of cold 70% (vol/vol) ethanol stored at -20 °C. Centrifuge the sample at 21,100 x g for 15 min at 4 °C.
Discard the supernatant and air-dry the pellet.
		NOTE: The pellet from step 3.5.9 can be stored at -20 °C for at least 2 days.
Gel electrophoresis and autoradiography
Resuspend the sample with 20 µL of RNase-free water.
Add 20 µL of 2x loading buffer.
Boil the sample for 10 min at 95 °C. Crush the sample on the ice.
Run the gel. In case the template size is 34 nts (see also step 3.4.3), 7 M Urea-10% polyacrylamide gel is used for denaturing gel electrophoresis.
Dry the gel with a gel dryer.
Expose the film to the dried-gel within an X-ray cassette with an intensifying screen at -80 °C.
